DataElement.preferredName: Pain Medication Clinical Study Protocol Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric or alphanumeric identification assigned to the study to the protocol for pain medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pain Medication Clinical Study Protocol Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the protocol coordinating identifier for pain medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Protocol associated with a clinical trial. Provides trial information such as organization ID, participants, phase and administered Agent. (NCICB):One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric or alphanumeric identification assigned to the study by the National Cancer Institute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
